items.title: Nuvama Wealth tanks 6% after Edelweiss group entities likely exit via Rs 2,100 cr block deal
items.description: Edelweiss group entities--Edel Finance Company and Ecap Equities currently held a combined stake of 7.32 percent in Nuvama Wealth Management. In September, they had offloaded another 6.2 percent stake in a previous block trade.

items.title: Waaree Energies stock gains 4% as firm bags 170 MW solar power plant project
items.description: Waaree Energies stock has witnessed a rollercoaster journey, soaring 50 percent to a record high of Rs 3,743 before sharp profit-booking dragged it off its peak. However, it has regained momentum with a steady rise in recent sessions.

items.title: L&T stock falls for third straight day despite Macquarie's 'outperform' rating
items.description: The brokerage highlighted that working capital terms in the Middle East remain favourable, prompting L&T to shift senior management personnel to the region.

items.title: In Charts: 5 deviations in post pandemic market trends
items.description: According to DSP’s report, sectors with low profit pools and market capitalization include Energy, Materials, Staples, and IT. On the other hand, sectors with high profit pools and market capitalization include Industrials, Financials, Consumer Discretionary, and Real Estate.

items.title: Investors are falling in love with railway stocks all over again. Will they be betrayed?

items.title: Gainers & Losers: 10 stocks that moved the most on December 12
items.description: All sectors barring information technology and metals ended in the red. The broader market also fell prey to profit booking with the small and midcap indices ending with losses.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty at 24,550, Sensex sheds 236 pts; eyes on CPI data
items.description: Except for IT, all other sectoral indices ended in the red with Media index down 2 percent and FMCG index shed 1 percent.

items.title: GHCL shares close 6% higher on government clearance for soda ash project in Gujarat
items.description: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Government of India, through its letter dated December 12, 2024, has approved the environmental clearance for the company’s Soda Ash Greenfield Project.

items.title: Live: Nifty Slips Below 24,600 On Weekly Expiry Day| IT Hits Record High| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty skids below 24,600 led by weakness in FMCG & autos. Broader markets snap gaining streak. All sectors barring IT & metals in red. Breadth poor; NSE advance-decline ratio at 2:5. Nifty gainers: Adani Ent, Bharti Airtel, Tech Mah, IndusInd, TCS. Nifty losers: NTPC, HUL, Hero Moto, BPCL, Coal India, Tata Motors. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss the stocks on their radar. #nse #bse #stockmarket #sharemarket
